content.question: Which of the following best explains how the prior development of the putting-out system created the conditions for the early mechanization of the textile industry in Europe?

choices.label: The putting-out system provided income for people working out of their homes.
The putting-out system did not require workers to be grouped together.
The putting-out system established a large and steady market demand for clothing.
The putting-out system was employed to produce a wide variety of clothing types.

content.answer: The putting-out system established a large and steady market demand for clothing.

topic.text: 6.1: Contextualizing Industrialization and its Origins and Effects
